title: Manchester United boss Jose Mourinho regrets his treatment of Bastian Schweinsteiger and even apologised to the German
text:
Sorry Schweini Manchester United boss Jose Mourinho regrets his treatment of Bastian Schweinsteiger and even apologised to the German 
The experienced German was frozen out at Old Trafford by Jose Mourinho and completed a move to MLS side Chicago Fire this week By Warren Haughton 31st March 2017, 2:15 pm Updated: 31st March 2017, 2:53 pm Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments MANCHESTER UNITED boss Jose Mourinho regrets his treatment of Bastian Schweinsteiger and has even apologised to the German. AP:Associated Press 4 Bastian Schweinsteiger was all smiles at the presser in Chicago despite being asked a silly question 
Schweinsteiger, 31, joined MLS outfit Chicago Fire on a free transfer after being frozen out by Mourinho for the majority of the season. 
Keep up to date with ALL the Manchester United news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
Mourinho revealed that he told the German World Cup winner before he left for Chicago, “I was not right with you once, I have to be right to you now”. PA:Press Association Manchester United boss Jose Mourinho regrets his treatment of Bastian Schweinsteiger Getty Images 4 Bastian Schweinsteiger wishes he could have done more during his time at Man Utd 
Mourinho added: “So when he was asking me to let him leave, I had to say yes, because I did it once, I cannot do it twice. 
“I feel sorry for the first period, I told him. I will miss a good guy, a good influence in training.

I would let him be in the squad. At that moment we had too many players.
Schweinsteiger moved to Old Trafford in 2015 on a three-year-deal from Bayern Munich under former United boss Louis van Gaal. Reuters 4 Bastian Schweinsteiger’s last appearance for Manchester United was the Europa League win at St Etienne 
But the midfielder was out in the cold following the arrival of Mourinho last summer and featured just four times this term, with his last game the Europa League first leg win in St Etienne. 
“After knowing him as a professional, as a person, the way he was respecting my decisions as a manager, yes I regret and no problem for me to admit it. "I thought that was not right, the mentality was not right, the kind of player I wouldn’t like to have in the squad."
